intro: Rivina laevis f. brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian smooth rivina, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
